items.title: Is 'mobile first' design still relevant?
items.content:
Unsubscribe

Frontend Focus

#‚Äã504 ‚Äî August 18, 2021 | Read on the web

The State of Mobile First and Desktop First ‚Äî Is mobile first or desktop first still relevant today? This article explores that question, outlining the pros and cons of such¬†approaches.

Ahmad Shadeed

Practical Uses of CSS Math Functions: calc, clamp, min, max ‚Äî Another solid post from Stephanie, this time looking at the four best supported CSS math functions, and how they can be used in both practical and unexpected ways, such as within gradients and color functions and in combination with CSS custom¬†properties.

Stephanie Eckles

Learn the Fundamentals of TypeScript ‚Äî Use TypeScript to add strong typing to large JavaScript apps helps reduce bugs and keeps code performant and maintainable. This course covers all you need to know including how to migrate your codebase to TypeScript and improve productivity while building large-scale apps with¬†ease.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Sustainable Web Design, An Excerpt ‚Äî This excerpt from Tom Greenwood‚Äôs book on Sustainable Web Design provides some much needed clear guidance on how we can track, and moreover address the carbon footprint of the websites we¬†create.

A List Apart

Breaking The Web Forward ‚Äî Thoughts on the current standing of browsers and the differing approaches of Safari and Chrome in¬†particular.

Peter-Paul Koch

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Mozilla is testing a change to the Firefox user agent. Will a three-digit "Firefox/100.0" break websites?
  • There seems to be a fair bit of chatter this week about plans (anounced last year) to disallow alert/prompt UI from a cross-origin iframe.
  • The accent-color CSS property will be landing in both Firefox and Chrome within the next two months ‚Äî¬†handy for adding your brand color to form inputs with just one line of code.
  • In this Twitter thread Hadi Partovi shared the rather rocky story behind the creation of IE 3, 25 years on.
  • Google removed a popular Chrome extension used by ~4 million people ‚Äî¬†here's the story of how the team behind it fixed it and got it back online.
  • Sacha Greif is seeking input for this year's upcoming State of CSS survey.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Accessible Contrast Ratios and A-Levels Explained ‚Äî A guide to understanding and making use of the labels and ratios that determine accessible contrast (those ‚ÄòA‚Äô, ‚ÄòAA‚Äô and ‚ÄòAAA‚Äô labels you may have¬†seen).

Stark Lab, Inc

The Accessibility and SEO Myth ‚Äî Cooper Hollmaier explains how search engine optimization and accessibility have a lot more in common than you may¬†think.

The A11y Project

Build a Powerful Backend for Your Frontend in Minutes ‚Äî Create, manage and deploy serverless backends using an intuitive interface for your web apps, mobile apps, and¬†microservices.

Canonic sponsor

HTML is Not a Programming Language? ‚Äî This discussion seems to pop up every now and again. This post looks at typical arguments, and some¬†rebuttals.

Alvaro Montoro

CSS Nesting, Specificity and You ‚Äî Native CSS nesting (like Sass or Less) is coming to browsers soon, meaning we can soon greatly cut down on repetitive selectors. Here‚Äôs what you need to know, and be careful¬†of.

Kilian Valkhof

Loading Third-Party JavaScript ‚Äî This isn‚Äôt new, but recently popped up on our radar again and remains a solid resource ‚Äî¬†learn how to optimize the loading of third-party scripts to reduce their impact on¬†performance.

Addy Osmani & Arthur Evans

How to Find The Cause of Horizontal Scrollbars
Polypane

How to Improve Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) on WordPress
Design Modo

Jobs

Frontend Engineer (React, New York) ‚Äî Dovetale helps Shopify merchants like KontrolFreek and Italic grow their creator community. Built in NYC and backed by Uber¬†founders.
Dovetale

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

SpeedVitals: Optimize Your Website for Core Web Vitals ‚Äî Enter a URL and select a type of device and country to run the various Core Web Vitals tests along with results you can use to make improvements. The layout shift animation is particularly¬†handy.

speedvitals

Blobbb: An Online Tool to Create Custom SVG Blobs ‚Äî Choose from three blob styles, fill color, optional stroke, and whether you want a gradient and/or pattern, then grab the SVG code or download as SVG¬†image.

Riva Yudha

React Page Scroller: Smooth Full-page Scrolling Using CSS Animations ‚Äî Try out two types of demos here.

Vik Liegostaiev

Serve Your Image Library on the Fly, Using a Simple Querystring API

OMGIMG sponsor

iColorpalette: A Platform for Creating, Editing, & Sharing Palettes

Fabrizio Bianchi

Geist: A Modern and Minimalist React UI Library ‚Äî Design inspired by Vercel and includes 50+ categorized components that you can view here on the documentation¬†site.

Geist

Introducing MIDIVal: The Easiest Way to Interact with MIDI in Your Browser ‚Äî Despite being 40 years old, the MIDI protocol is still heavily used by, and hugely valuable to, musicians. MIDIVal is a higher level abstraction for working with MIDI from JavaScript. Getting started¬†tutorial.

Kacper Kula

‚ÄúSaving the Internet requires a greater sense of shared ownership and fewer bystanders accepting whatever today's Internet has to offer.‚Äù

___
Mitchell Baker¬†(via CodeWisdom)

items.content:
Unsubscribe

#‚Äã503 ‚Äî August 11, 2021 | Read on the web

The World of CSS Transforms ‚Äî Another excellent blog post from Josh, this time looking at the power of CSS transforms. Expect a detailed look at the transform property, with some nifty examples of what it can¬†do.

Josh W Comeau

HTTP/3 From A To Z: Core Concepts ‚Äî What exactly is HTTP/3? Why was it needed so soon after HTTP/2 (which was only finalized in 2015)? How can or should you use it? And especially, how does this improve web performance? Find out¬†here.

Robin Marx

Walkthrough of an Easy Angular Data Grid with Examples ‚Äî You could write your own data grid, but why would you when this one already exists. See how easy it is to set up, bind data, group, sort, page, and more. Fiddle with the live samples or install it and try it for yourself, but don‚Äôt miss¬†it.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

Firefox 91 Introduces 'Enhanced Cookie Clearing' ‚Äî The latest version of Mozilla‚Äôs browser introduces a new, major privacy enhancement to cookie handling ‚Äî letting you fully erase your browser history for any website. Here‚Äôs the full release notes and notable developer changes for this¬†version.

Z√ºhlcke, Hofmann and Edelstein (Mozilla)

Writing Great Alt Text: Emotion Matters ‚Äî Getting alt text right can be tricky, as this post outlines how both context and emotion can play an important role in any decision as to what you ultimately end up writing, if¬†anything.

Jake Archibald

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Looks like version 92 of Firefox will support the AVIF image format.
  • Chrome's intent to remove support for cross origin IFRAMEs to trigger window.alert, prompt and confirm dialogs has fallen into some trouble.
  • Here's a friendly introduction to digital accessibility based on WCAG 2.1
  • Version 6.3 of dev browser Polypane can now inspect web manifest files and has an interactive tunnel vision simulator.
  • The web is 30 years old. "Try it."
  • Firefox has reportedly lost nearly 50 million users over the last three years.
  • This site has over 300 developer cheatsheets, so you're bound to find something handy here.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

There Is No Such Thing as a CSS Absolute Unit ‚Äî What are absolute units? What are the differences between relative and absolute units, and how do we create accurate sizes on the web? This article sets out to explain why CSS absolute units aren‚Äôt so¬†absolute.

Elad Shechter

CSS Logical Properties and Values ‚Äî Cross-browser support is at a tipping point, so it‚Äôs a good time to take a look at logical properties and values. Ollie covers some convenient new shorthands worth knowing¬†about.

Ollie Williams

CSS Architecture and Performance in Micro Frontends ‚Äî This an interesting dive into how to manage CSS-related architecture and web performance at¬†scale.

Mateusz Krzeszowiak

Ensure Frontend Issues Don‚Äôt Impair User Experience with Datadog ‚Äî Monitor frontend errors and performance errors by analyzing user sessions and receiving actionable alerts from Datadog. Start a free¬†trial.

Datadog Real User Monitoring sponsor

Creating a 'Superhero' Animation Effect with SVG Filters ‚Äî See how to create and animate a comic book style transitionary illustration effect using SVG filters and¬†masks.

Abner Nascimento

Print Media Style 'Drop Caps' With Only CSS ‚Äî It‚Äôs that classical bookish effect where the first letter in a paragraph is much larger than any¬†other.

Amit Merchant

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Compressed.fm: A Weekly Podcast on Web Design and Development
Amy Dutton and James Q Quick podcast

Exploring the CSS Paint API: Image Fragmentation Effect
Temani Afif

Jobs

Kraken

Full Stack Utviklere ‚Äî Visma s√∏ker utvikler i Norge eller Sverige. Avansert javascriptutvikling som minner mer om spillprogrammering enn tradisjonell¬†koding.
Visma

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Bootstrap 5.1.0 ‚Äî The first minor release of Bootstrap 5 adds experimental support for CSS Grid, a new placeholders component (shown above), horizontal collapse support, new helpers, new CSS variables in our utilities, refactored JavaScript, and¬†more.

Mark Otto

View Source: A Way to View a Page's Source If You Otherwise¬†Can't ‚Äî Given a URL, this page lets you look at the HTML returned. Handy on mobile or kiosk devices, perhaps, where the natural ‚Äòview source‚Äô functionality isn‚Äôt¬†available. (Feed the tool's URL back to itself if you want a laugh.)

Neatnik

Glassmorphism CSS Generator: Generate CSS for a Frosted Glass Effect on Various UI Components

Themesberg

If You Can Write It with JavaScript and an API, You Can Build It 10x Faster in Retool

Retool sponsor

inLine: A Simple JavaScript WYSIWYG Editor

Felice Gattuso

Livemark ‚Äî Livemark allows you to add interactive charts, tables, and scripts to Markdown and generate¬†HTML.

Frictionless Data

Slinkity ‚Äî Slinkity is basically what you‚Äôd get if you tried to build Astro on top of Eleventy. It allows component frameworks (React, Vue, and Svelte) for writing page/layout templates and hydrates component-driven pages on the¬†client.

Ben Holmes

items.content:
Unsubscribe

Frontend Focus

#‚Äã502 ‚Äî August 4, 2021 | Read on the web

Refactoring CSS: Strategy, Regression Testing and¬†Maintenance ‚Äî A detailed guide on taking an incremental approach to refactoring CSS, with pointers on strategy, visual regression testing, and maintaining a refactored¬†codebase.

Adrian Bece

The 2021 Scroll Survey Report ‚Äî The Chrome team has shared the results from its ‚ÄòScroll Survey Report‚Äô and here are the highlights of the results with detail on how this impacts priorities and plans for¬†Chromium.

Adam Argyle & Sam Dutton (Google)

Build a Zoom Clone by Following Working¬†Code ‚Äî Build an audio/video conferencing application like Zoom or Teams to talk to your friends and family. Follow along with fully functioning code and customize and enhance to unleash your creativity. Show us what you can¬†build.

SignalWire sponsor

Creating an Accessible Dialog from Scratch ‚Äî Dialogs are everywhere in modern interface design, and yet many of them are not accessible to assistive technologies. This article digs into how to create a short script to create accessible¬†dialogs.

Kitty Giraudel

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Here's a look at the latest changes in the beta of Chrome 93.
  • AWS is ending its support for Internet Explorer 11.
  • Version 4.1 of the Vivaldi has a new macro system, and something they're calling 'accordian tabs'.
  • Here's a handy list of over 200 open-source alternatives to popular tools (think analytics, CMS, CRM, etc).

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Aligning a Button Label Vertically ‚Äî Yup, each and every font can have a unique line-height, with differing spacing both above and below the text ‚Äî this can often cause problems when trying to align content. Here‚Äôs what to do about¬†it.

Ahmad Shadeed

A Framework for Building Open Graph Images ‚Äî The team at GitHub recently set about creating a framework and service for automatically generating social sharing images for repositories and other resources. Here‚Äôs the¬†story.

Jason Etcovich

Application Performance Monitoring in Real Time ‚Äî Learn how to use time series data for real-time observability into application performance, systems and network¬†metrics.

InfluxData sponsor

Practical Use Cases for Scroll-Linked Animations in CSS with Scroll Timelines ‚Äî Some practical use cases where scroll-linked animations (an experimental spec for now) may come in handy, and how they can enrich your visitor‚Äôs browsing¬†experience.

Bramus Van Damme

Peter Bengtsson (Mozilla)

Break HTML Content Into Newspaper-Like Columns with Pure¬†CSS ‚Äî Sometimes, the things you might think are tricky to implement can turn out to be a matter of just a few lines of code if you read the¬†documentation.

Amit Merchant

'Safari Isn't Protecting The Web, It's Killing It' ‚Äî Tim presents a clear argument for why Apple‚Äôs browser is failing when it comes to feature support, API proposals, release cadence, bug fixing, and¬†more.

Tim Perry opinion
